page.title: 13POLLUTION-OUTWOOD AREA
page.content: THE TEXTILE INDUSTRY IN LANCASHIRE AND YORKSHIRE HAS CAUSED POLLUTION OVER THE LAST TWO CENTURIES.SMOKE FROM MILLS IN LANCASHIRE,CARRIED OVER THE PENNINES BY THE PREVAILING WESTERLY WIND, ADDED TO SMOKE FROM WEST RIDING WOOLEN MILLS, HAS BLACKENED MANY BUILDINGS ERECTED DURING VICTORIAN TIMES OR EARLIER ESPECIALLY WHERE SANDSTONE OR LIMESTONE HAS BEEN USED. THE CLEAN AIR ACT HAS REDUCED THIS AND SCRUBBING WITH A CAUSTIC SOLUTION HAS RESTORED THE ORIGINAL TEXTURE.SOOT KILLED FRUIT TREES BUT SUITED RHUBARB SO THAT WAKEFIELD BECAME THE MAIN GROWING AREA IN THE U.K. THIS IS NOW DECLINING.DYE FROM TEXTILE MILLS UPSTREAM MADE THE CALDER THE MOST POLLUTED OF ALL RIVERS BUT THE DECLINE IN TEXTILE MANUFACTURE HAS EASED MATTERS AND FISH HAVE REAPPEARED AT STANLEY FERRY.
